title: Slack
description: One way to interact with the Slack platform is its HTTP RPC-based Web API, a collection of methods requiring OAuth 2.0-based user, bot, or workspace tokens blessed with related OAuth scopes.

fields.redirect_uri: The callback URL for your application

defs_invite_id.title: Invite ID for an external shared channel

defs_room_id.title: Room ID for a slack call

defs_topic_purpose_creator.title: User ID or empty string, used for topic and purpose creation

unlinked.title: Field to determine whether a channel has ever been shared/disconnected in the past
Field to determine whether a channel has ever been shared/disconnected in the past
Field to determine whether a channel has ever been shared/disconnected in the past

items.title: Conversation IM Channel Object from conversations.* methods

actions.description: Exchange the code passed to your redirect URI for an access_token
Exchange a refresh_token for an access_token

actions.title: chat_delete
actions.description: Deletes a message.

as_user.description: Pass true to delete the message as the authed user with `chat:write:user` scope. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users. If unused or false, the message will be deleted with `chat:write:bot` scope.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to be deleted.

channel.description: Channel containing the message to be deleted.

outputSchema.description: Verbose schema not yet ready for this method.
outputSchema.title: Default success template

actions.title: chat_meMessage
actions.description: Share a me message into a channel.

text.description: Text of the message to send.

channel.description: Channel to send message to. Can be a public channel, private group or IM channel. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

outputSchema.description: Verbose schema not yet ready for this method.
outputSchema.title: Default success template

actions.title: chat_postEphemeral
actions.description: Sends an ephemeral message to a user in a channel.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

text.description: Text of the message to send. See below for an explanation of [formatting](#formatting). This field is usually required, unless you're providing only `attachments` instead.

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `none`. See [below](#formatting).

user.description: `id` of the user who will receive the ephemeral message. The user should be in the channel specified by the `channel` argument.

as_user.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed bot. Defaults to false.

channel.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name.

outputSchema.description: Schema for successful response of chat.postEphemeral method
outputSchema.title: chat.postEphemeral success schema

actions.title: chat_postMessage
actions.description: Sends a message to a channel.

username.description: Set your bot's user name. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

thread_ts.description: Provide another message's `ts` value to make this message a reply. Avoid using a reply's `ts` value; use its parent instead.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string.

unfurl_links.description: Pass true to enable unfurling of primarily text-based content.

text.description: Text of the message to send. See below for an explanation of [formatting](#formatting). This field is usually required, unless you're providing only `attachments` instead.

unfurl_media.description: Pass false to disable unfurling of media content.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `none`. See [below](#formatting).

as_user.description: Pass true to post the message as the authed user, instead of as a bot. Defaults to false. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

icon_emoji.description: Emoji to use as the icon for this message. Overrides `icon_url`. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to `false`, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames.

icon_url.description: URL to an image to use as the icon for this message. Must be used in conjunction with `as_user` set to false, otherwise ignored. See [authorship](#authorship) below.

channel.description: Channel, private group, or IM channel to send message to. Can be an encoded ID, or a name. See [below](#channels) for more details.

reply_broadcast.description: Used in conjunction with `thread_ts` and indicates whether reply should be made visible to everyone in the channel or conversation. Defaults to `false`.

outputSchema.description: Schema for successful response of chat.postMessage method
outputSchema.title: chat.postMessage success schema

actions.title: chat_unfurl
actions.description: Provide custom unfurl behavior for user-posted URLs

user_auth_message.description: Provide a simply-formatted string to send as an ephemeral message to the user as invitation to authenticate further and enable full unfurling behavior

user_auth_required.description: Set to `true` or `1` to indicate the user must install your Slack app to trigger unfurls for this domain

unfurls.description: URL-encoded JSON map with keys set to URLs featured in the the message, pointing to their unfurl message attachments.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to add unfurl behavior to.

user_auth_url.description: Send users to this custom URL where they will complete authentication in your app to fully trigger unfurling. Value should be properly URL-encoded.

channel.description: Channel ID of the message

outputSchema.description: Schema for successful response of chat.unfurl method
outputSchema.title: chat.unfurl success schema

actions.title: chat_update
actions.description: Updates a message.

attachments.description: A JSON-based array of structured attachments, presented as a URL-encoded string. This field is required when not presenting `text`.

text.description: New text for the message, using the [default formatting rules](/docs/formatting). It's not required when presenting `attachments`.

ts.description: Timestamp of the message to be updated.

parse.description: Change how messages are treated. Defaults to `client`, unlike `chat.postMessage`. See [below](#formatting).

as_user.description: Pass true to update the message as the authed user. [Bot users](/bot-users) in this context are considered authed users.

link_names.description: Find and link channel names and usernames. Defaults to `none`. This parameter should be used in conjunction with `parse`. To set `link_names` to `1`, specify a `parse` mode of `full`.

channel.description: Channel containing the message to be updated.

outputSchema.description: Schema for successful response of chat.update method
outputSchema.title: chat.update success schema

exclude_archived.description: Set to `true` to exclude archived channels from the list

limit.description: The maximum number of items to return. Fewer than the requested number of items may be returned, even if the end of the list hasn't been reached. Must be an integer no larger than 1000.

actions.description: Opens or resumes a direct message or multi-person direct message.

return_im.description: Boolean, indicates you want the full IM channel definition in the response.

users.description: Comma separated lists of users. If only one user is included, this creates a 1:1 DM.  The ordering of the users is preserved whenever a multi-person direct message is returned. Supply a `channel` when not supplying `users`.

channel.description: Resume a conversation by supplying an `im` or `mpim`'s ID. Or provide the `users` field instead.

actions.title: files_list
actions.description: Lists & filters team files.

channel.description: Filter files appearing in a specific channel, indicated by its ID.

ts_to.description: Filter files created before this timestamp (inclusive).

ts_from.description: Filter files created after this timestamp (inclusive).

user.description: Filter files created by a single user.

types.description:
Filter files by type:

* `all` - All files
* `spaces` - Posts
* `snippets` - Snippets
* `images` - Image files
* `gdocs` - Google docs
* `zips` - Zip files
* `pdfs` - PDF files

You can pass multiple values in the types argument, like `types=spaces,snippets`.The default value is `all`, which does not filter the list.

outputSchema.description: Verbose schema not yet ready for this method.
outputSchema.title: Default success template
